description: From Middle French persister (Modern French persister), from Latin persistere, from per- + sistere (“to stand”).

verbs.description: persist (third-person singular simple present persists, present participle persisting, simple past and past participle persisted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go on stubbornly or resolutely.
(intransitive, copulative, obsolete) To continue to be; to remain.
(computing, transitive) To cause to persist; make permanent.
examples: This would not be saved after his session terminates because we don't have an actual user identity to allow us to persist the settings.
